page.title: 05Birds at Kirkandrews
page.content: From our school we are able to observe the arrival in the fields near the River Eden of the visiting Geese which over-winter on our coast. We see Barnacle Geese arrive in October feeding in the fields on the north bank of the River Eden. In March of this year I observed forty Whooper Swans on the tidal section of the River Eden who stayed a few days. From time to time a dead Swan is found on the banks of the river. On a walk along the river bank in May I saw a variety of birds. Sand Martins who had built their nests in the sandy banks and were now catching flies for their young. On the river I observed Goosander, Shelduck and Oystercatchers', and flying overhead were Swifts, Snipes and Golden Plovers.
